metadata.title: CVE-2019-18676 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in Squid 3.x and 4.x through 4.8. Due to incorrectinput validation, there is a heap-based buffer overflow that can result inDenial of Service to all clients using the proxy. Severity is high due tothis vulnerability occurring before normal security checks; any remoteclient that can reach the proxy port can trivially perform the attack via acrafted URI scheme.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-18676` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

squid - 4.9-2ubuntu1
squid-cgi - 4.9-2ubuntu1
squid-common - 4.9-2ubuntu1
squid-purge - 4.9-2ubuntu1
squid3 - 4.9-2ubuntu1
squidclient - 4.9-2ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: squid package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.9-2ubuntu1').
